word.entryDescription: in a way that is not fast
word.entryExample: She walked slowly out of the room.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: not large
word.entryExample: A hamster is a small animal.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to move the corners of your mouth upwards, usually in a friendly or happy way
word.entryExample: I'm taking a photo. Smile please!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a long thin animal that has no legs and moves along the ground
word.entryExample: Are you afraid of snakes?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to suddenly push air out of your nose while making a sound
word.entryExample: I'm going to sneeze, I'm sorry!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: soft white ice that falls from the sky, and may form a layer on the ground
word.entryExample: I love playing in the snow.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a human figure you make outside by rolling up large balls of snow
word.entryExample: Let's make a snowman now!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: and for that reason
word.entryExample: I was late for school, so I couldn't talk about my project in class.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: one of the things you wear on your feet under your shoes
word.entryExample: Where are my socks?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a soft comfortable seat that more than one person can sit on
word.entryExample: Our new sofa was very expensive.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a quantity of
word.entryExample: There's some sugar in the cupboard.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: used for giving a description or amount that is not exact
word.entryExample: Can you tell me something about your new teacher?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: on some occasions
word.entryExample: I sometimes read in the evenings.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: your male child
word.entryExample: My son wants to be a fire-fighter like me.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a dish of hot liquid, often containing meat and vegetables
word.entryExample: Would you like some tomato soup?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the direction that is normally at the bottom of a map
word.entryExample: I come from the south of England.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a continent made up of all the countries in the lower half of America
word.entryExample: The Amazon river is in South America.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to be able to say words, have a conversation or talk in a language
word.entryExample: Excuse me, do you speak English?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to put the letters in a word in the correct order
word.entryExample: Can you spell your name?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a small creature with eight legs that usually catches its food in a web
word.entryExample: Can you see this big, black spider on the window?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a building in which you can do different kinds of sports and physical activities
word.entryExample: You can go swimming at the local sports centre.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an open area in the middle of a town or city
word.entryExample: The square is full of shops and restaurants.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a series of steps that you use to walk up and down between levels of a building
word.entryExample: I think it's easier to take a lift than to go up the stairs.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to move your body into a standing position
word.entryExample: The teacher says 'Stand up!'
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: bright balls of gas you can see at night that look like points of light
word.entryExample: How many stars are there in the sky?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to do and then continue to do something that was not happening before
word.entryExample: School starts at 9 o'clock.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the part of your body where food goes after it leaves your mouth
word.entryExample: What's the matter with your stomach?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a pain in your stomach
word.entryExample: Alex has a stomachache.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a small piece of rock
word.entryExample: I found this beautiful stone when we went to the beach for a walk.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to no longer do something
word.entryExample: The pirate stopped looking for the treasure.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: an account of something that happened, either true or imaginary
word.entryExample: She told me a funny story about her cat.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: in a line that does not have any curves or bends or corners
word.entryExample: She has long straight hair.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a small juicy red fruit which grows on a low plant
word.entryExample: I'd like strawberry ice cream, please..
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a road that usually has buildings on its sides
word.entryExample: I live in the longest street in my town.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: physically powerful
word.entryExample: Who is strong in your family?
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: quickly and without being expected
word.entryExample: Suddenly, the door opened and I saw an old woman.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a sweet powder made from a plant which you add to food and drinks
word.entryExample: There's a lot of sugar in the cake.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the large bright object in the sky which gives us light and heat
word.entryExample: The sun is shining.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the day between Saturday and Monday
word.entryExample: We have dinner at our grandparents' every Sunday.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: having a lot of light from the sun
word.entryExample: It's sunny - let's have a barbecue.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a big shop selling lots of things, especially food and things for the house
word.entryExample: Mum usually goes shopping in the big supermarket.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: something unexpected that happens
word.entryExample: Let's have a surprise party for Sam this year!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to move through water using your arms and legs
word.entryExample: I can't swim very well.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a place in a town for swimming
word.entryExample: I swim at the swimming pool every Saturday.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a piece of clothing with short sleeves you wear over the top half of your body
word.entryExample: Tim has a new T-shirt.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a piece of furniture with legs and a wide flat top we use to put things
word.entryExample: We sit at the table and have lunch.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: a game played on a large table in which you use small round bats to hit a small ball over a low net
word.entryExample: We play table tennis at lunchtime.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: the part of an animal's body that joins onto the bottom of its back
word.entryExample: Cats have long tails.
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to accept something that someone gives you
word.entryExample: This present is for you - please take it!
word.label: ydp

word.entryDescription: to remove an item of clothing
word.entryExample: Take off your coat and put it in the cupboard.
word.label: ydp
